results.name: E.g.f. exp( sinh(x) / exp(x) ) = exp( (1-exp(-2*x))/2 ).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..529
I. M. Gessel, Applications of the classical umbral calculus, arXiv:math/0108121 [math.CO], 2001.
formula: Recurrence equation: a(n+1) = Sum_{k = 0..n} (-2)^(n-k)*C(n,k)*a(k). Written umbrally this is a(n+1) = (a-2)^n (expand the binomial and replace a^k with a(k)). More generally, a*f(a) = f(a-2) holds umbrally for any polynomial f(x). An inductive argument then establishes the umbral recurrence a*(a+2)*(a+4)*...*(a+2*(n-1)) = 1 with a(0) = 1. Cf. A004211.
Touchard's congruence holds for odd prime p: a(p+k) = (a(k) + a(k+1)) (mod p) for k = 0,1,2, ... (adapt the proof of Theorem 10.1 in Gessel). In particular, a(p) = 2 (mod p) for odd prime p. (End)
Lim sup n->infinity (abs(a(n))/n!)^(1/n) / (2*abs(exp(1/LambertW(-2*n)) / LambertW(-2*n))) = 1. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 04 2014
a(n) = (-2)^n*B_n(-1/2), where B_n(x) is n-th Bell polynomial. - _Vladimir Reshetnikov_, Oct 20 2015
G.f. A(x) satisfies: A(x) = 1 + x*A(x/(1 + 2*x))/(1 + 2*x). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, May 02 2019
results.author: _R. H. Hardin_
